name: Navigation Bar
description: A horizontal bar at the top of the screen that provides contextual title, navigation controls, and action items.

parts.label: Leading Icon / Back Button
parts.description: Left-aligned navigation control, typically a back arrow or hamburger menu icon.

parts.label: Title
parts.description: Centered or left-aligned text that describes the current screen or section.

parts.label: Trailing Actions
parts.description: Right-aligned action buttons or icons (e.g., search, share, overflow menu).

parts.label: Background Surface
parts.description: The bar background, which may be opaque, translucent, or blurred.

placement.position: Top edge of the screen
placement.context: Present on nearly every screen in an app, provides persistent navigation context.

behavior.appears: Always visible when a screen loads; may collapse on scroll (collapsing toolbar pattern).
behavior.interaction: Tap back button to navigate back; tap action items to trigger functions.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists throughout the screen lifecycle.
gestures: Swipe from left edge to go back (iOS)

platformVariations.name: UINavigationBar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Large title style (iOS 11+); translucent with blur effect by default.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports large title that collapses on scroll. Swipe-back gesture from left edge.

platformVariations.name: NSToolbar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Integrated with the title bar; unified appearance with window controls.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be customized by users; supports flexible/fixed items and overflow.

platformVariations.name: TopAppBar (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Left-aligned title by default; supports small, medium, and large variants.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Scrolling behavior includes pin, scroll-off, and compress. Overflow menu for additional actions.

platformVariations.name: TitleBar / CommandBar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Often combined with window title bar; uses system accent color.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can include back button, title, and command buttons. Supports compact and expanded modes.

platformVariations.name: Header / Navbar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Typically a fixed or sticky header with logo, nav links, and actions.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Often sticky at top of viewport. May include responsive hamburger menu for mobile.

name: Tab Bar
description: A bar at the bottom (or top on web) of the screen with icons and labels for switching between top-level app sections.

parts.label: Tab Item
parts.description: Individual tab consisting of an icon and optional text label.

parts.label: Active Indicator
parts.description: Visual highlight showing the currently selected tab (fill, underline, or pill).

parts.label: Badge
parts.description: Optional notification dot or count badge overlaid on a tab icon.

parts.label: Bar Container
parts.description: The background container that holds all tab items.

placement.position: Bottom edge of the screen (iOS, Android); top or bottom on web
placement.context: Visible on all top-level screens; typically 3–5 tab destinations.

behavior.appears: Always visible on main screens; may hide during full-screen content or detail views.
behavior.interaction: Tap a tab to switch to that section; double-tap to scroll to top (iOS).
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persistent navigation element.

platformVariations.name: UITabBar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom bar with filled/outlined icons and labels; translucent background with blur.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports up to 5 visible tabs with a 'More' tab for additional items. Badge support built-in.

platformVariations.name: NavigationBar (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom bar with pill-shaped active indicator; icons with optional labels.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: 3–5 destinations recommended. Can hide on scroll. Supports badges.

platformVariations.name: Tab Navigation / Bottom Nav
platformVariations.visualNotes: May be top-aligned tabs or bottom navigation on mobile web; styled with CSS.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Behavior varies widely. Tab-panel ARIA pattern recommended for accessibility.

name: Sidebar / Navigation Drawer
description: A vertical panel at the side of the screen listing navigation destinations, often collapsible or toggled by a menu icon.

parts.label: Header / Profile Area
parts.description: Optional top section with app logo, user avatar, or account info.

parts.label: Navigation Items
parts.description: Vertically stacked list of destinations, each with icon and label.

parts.label: Active Indicator
parts.description: Highlight on the currently selected navigation item.

parts.label: Divider / Section Header
parts.description: Optional separators grouping related navigation items.

parts.label: Scrim / Overlay
parts.description: Semi-transparent backdrop shown when drawer overlays content (modal mode).

placement.position: Left edge of the screen (or right in RTL layouts)
placement.context: Used for apps with many sections; can be persistent (desktop) or modal (mobile).

behavior.appears: Toggled by a hamburger icon or swipe gesture; persistent on wide screens.
behavior.interaction: Tap an item to navigate; may support expand/collapse for nested sections.
behavior.dismissal: Tap outside or swipe to close (modal mode); always visible in persistent mode.
gestures: Swipe from left edge to open (Android, iOS)

platformVariations.name: UISplitViewController sidebar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Translucent sidebar in split view; list-style navigation.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: On iPad, shown persistently in landscape; overlays in portrait. On iPhone, collapses to push navigation.

platformVariations.name: NSOutlineView sidebar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Source list style with disclosure triangles for hierarchy.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Persistent; can be toggled with the sidebar button. Supports drag-to-resize.

platformVariations.name: NavigationDrawer (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Modal drawer slides in from left with rounded corners and active pill indicator.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Opened via hamburger icon or edge swipe. Scrim overlay blocks content interaction.

platformVariations.name: NavigationView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Hamburger navigation with compact (icons only) and expanded (icons + labels) states.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports top, left-compact, left-expanded, and minimal display modes.

platformVariations.name: Sidebar Navigation
platformVariations.visualNotes: Fixed or collapsible left panel; often responsive — drawer on mobile, persistent on desktop.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Toggle via hamburger button. Common pattern: off-canvas for mobile, inline for desktop.

name: Breadcrumb
description: A horizontal trail of links showing the user's current location within a hierarchical navigation structure.

parts.label: Breadcrumb Item
parts.description: A clickable link representing one level in the hierarchy.

parts.label: Separator
parts.description: A visual divider between items, typically '>' or '/'.

parts.label: Current Page
parts.description: The last item, representing the current page; usually non-clickable and visually distinct.

placement.position: Top of the content area, below the navigation bar
placement.context: Common in content-heavy apps, documentation sites, and file managers.

behavior.appears: Always visible on pages with hierarchical depth.
behavior.interaction: Click any ancestor item to navigate to that level.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; part of the page content.

platformVariations.name: Breadcrumb (HTML nav)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Horizontal text links with '>' or '/' separators; uses nav and ol/li elements.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: ARIA breadcrumb landmark. Last item is aria-current='page'.

platformVariations.name: BreadcrumbBar
platformVariations.visualNotes: WinUI BreadcrumbBar with chevron separators and dropdown overflow.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports overflow with ellipsis dropdown for deep hierarchies.

platformVariations.name: Path Bar / NSPathControl
platformVariations.visualNotes: Path bar at the bottom of Finder windows showing folder hierarchy.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Click any component to navigate to that folder; supports drag-and-drop.

name: Menu Bar
description: A horizontal bar at the top of the application window containing dropdown menus for commands and settings.

parts.label: Menu Title
parts.description: Top-level clickable label (e.g., File, Edit, View) that opens a dropdown.

parts.label: Dropdown Menu
parts.description: A vertical list of commands that appears when a menu title is clicked.

parts.label: Menu Item
parts.description: Individual command within a dropdown, with optional icon, shortcut, and submenu arrow.

parts.label: Separator
parts.description: A horizontal line dividing groups of related menu items.

placement.position: Top edge of the screen (macOS) or top of the application window (Windows, web)
placement.context: Primary command access for desktop applications; less common on mobile.

behavior.appears: Always visible in desktop applications.
behavior.interaction: Click a menu title to open its dropdown; hover to switch between menus; click an item to execute.
behavior.dismissal: Click outside or press Escape to close the dropdown.
gestures: Keyboard shortcuts shown next to menu items
Arrow keys to navigate within menus

platformVariations.name: NSMenu / Menu Bar
platformVariations.visualNotes: System-level menu bar at the top of the screen; shared across all apps.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Changes based on focused application. Supports system-wide search with Help menu.

platformVariations.name: MenuBar / MenuStrip
platformVariations.visualNotes: In-window menu bar below the title bar; uses system font.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Activates on Alt key press. Supports underline mnemonics for keyboard access.

platformVariations.name: Menu Bar (ARIA)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom-styled horizontal menu; often part of web-based IDEs or document editors.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Should implement ARIA menubar role with keyboard navigation for accessibility.

name: Button
description: A clickable/tappable element that triggers an action when pressed.

parts.label: Label Text
parts.description: The primary text describing the action.

parts.label: Leading Icon
parts.description: Optional icon before the label for visual context.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: The background shape (filled, outlined, or text-only).

parts.label: State Layer
parts.description: Visual feedback layer showing hover, pressed, focused, or disabled states.

placement.position: Inline within content, in toolbars, in dialogs, or as floating actions
placement.context: Ubiquitous; used wherever an action needs to be triggered.

behavior.appears: Always present where actions are available.
behavior.interaction: Click or tap to activate; may show loading state while processing.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; a static interactive element.

platformVariations.name: UIButton
platformVariations.visualNotes: Multiple styles: plain, gray, tinted, filled. Rounded corners with system colors.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports haptic feedback on press. Dynamic Type for text scaling.

platformVariations.name: NSButton
platformVariations.visualNotes: Push button, checkbox, radio, toggle variants. Standard macOS chrome appearance.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Keyboard accessible via Tab and Space. Supports bevel, round, and recessed styles.

platformVariations.name: Button (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Filled, outlined, text, elevated, and tonal variants with rounded corners.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Ripple effect on press. Supports icon buttons and extended FAB-like buttons.

platformVariations.name: Button (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded rectangle with Fluent Design reveal highlight on hover.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports accent styling for primary actions. Keyboard accessible.

platformVariations.name: button / a element
platformVariations.visualNotes: Styling varies widely by framework. Typically filled or outlined with hover transitions.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Must be a <button> for actions (not <div>). ARIA role=button for non-semantic elements.

name: Text Field
description: A single-line or multi-line input field where users can enter and edit text.

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Text above or inside the field describing the expected input.

parts.label: Input Area
parts.description: The editable text region where the user types.

parts.label: Placeholder Text
parts.description: Hint text shown when the field is empty.

parts.label: Leading/Trailing Icon
parts.description: Optional icons for context (search icon) or actions (clear button).

parts.label: Helper/Error Text
parts.description: Supporting text below the field for validation feedback.

parts.label: Border / Underline
parts.description: Visual boundary of the input area; may change on focus.

placement.position: Inline within forms, search bars, and dialogs
placement.context: Used wherever text input is needed — login forms, search, settings.

behavior.appears: Always visible in forms; may appear in search contexts on demand.
behavior.interaction: Tap/click to focus; type to enter text; clear button to reset.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; tap outside or press Return to blur.
gestures: Tap to focus and show keyboard (mobile)

platformVariations.name: UITextField / UITextView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded rectangle with light gray background; floating label support in forms.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Shows system keyboard on focus. Supports autocomplete, secure entry, and content type hints.

platformVariations.name: NSTextField
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bordered or borderless text field; system font and styling.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports undo/redo, spell check, and dictation. Tab to navigate between fields.

platformVariations.name: TextField (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Filled or outlined variant; floating label that animates up on focus.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Shows soft keyboard on focus. Supports input types, error states, and character counters.

platformVariations.name: TextBox (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Flat design with bottom border emphasis; header label support.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports placeholder text, spell checking, and input validation.

platformVariations.name: input[type=text] / textarea
platformVariations.visualNotes: Default browser styling varies; typically styled with CSS frameworks.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports HTML5 validation attributes (required, pattern, maxlength). ARIA labels for accessibility.

name: Checkbox
description: A small square control that can be checked (selected), unchecked (deselected), or indeterminate, used for multiple-choice selections.

parts.label: Box
parts.description: The square container that shows checked/unchecked/indeterminate state.

parts.label: Checkmark
parts.description: The indicator (check icon or dash for indeterminate) inside the box.

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Adjacent text describing the option.

placement.position: Inline within forms, settings panels, and lists
placement.context: Used for selecting multiple options from a group, or toggling a single setting.

behavior.appears: Always visible where a binary or multi-selection choice exists.
behavior.interaction: Click/tap the box or its label to toggle the state.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists in the form.
gestures: Click or Space key to toggle (desktop)

platformVariations.name: Checkmark in UITableViewCell
platformVariations.visualNotes: iOS does not have a native checkbox; uses checkmark accessory in list rows or toggle switches.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Tap the row to toggle checkmark. Often replaced with UISwitch for single toggles.

platformVariations.name: NSButton (checkbox style)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Standard checkbox with system styling; square with rounded corners.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports mixed (indeterminate) state. Keyboard toggleable with Space.

platformVariations.name: Checkbox (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded square with animated checkmark; supports error state.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Ripple effect on toggle. Can be part of a checkbox group.

platformVariations.name: CheckBox (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Square with Fluent Design; animated check/uncheck transitions.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports three states: checked, unchecked, indeterminate.

platformVariations.name: input[type=checkbox]
platformVariations.visualNotes: Browser-default or custom-styled square box; varies widely by browser.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports indeterminate state via JavaScript. Associate with label via for/id for accessibility.

name: Toggle / Switch
description: A control that switches between two mutually exclusive states (on/off), typically with a sliding thumb on a track.

parts.label: Track
parts.description: The horizontal channel that the thumb slides along.

parts.label: Thumb
parts.description: The circular handle that moves between the on and off positions.

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Adjacent text describing what the switch controls.

parts.label: On/Off Icon
parts.description: Optional icon inside the thumb or track indicating state.

placement.position: Inline within settings screens, list items, and forms
placement.context: Used for binary on/off settings where the effect is immediate.

behavior.appears: Always visible where an immediate on/off toggle is needed.
behavior.interaction: Tap or click to toggle; drag the thumb to slide between states.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists in the settings context.

platformVariations.name: UISwitch
platformVariations.visualNotes: Green track when on, gray when off; white circular thumb.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Immediate effect (no save button needed). Haptic feedback on toggle.

platformVariations.name: NSSwitch
platformVariations.visualNotes: Similar to iOS switch; smaller size for desktop context.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Click to toggle. No drag interaction on macOS.

platformVariations.name: Switch (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Track with a thumb that includes an optional icon; color changes on state.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Drag or tap to toggle. May show icon inside the thumb.

platformVariations.name: ToggleSwitch (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rectangular track with 'On'/'Off' text labels and sliding circle.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Click to toggle. Supports header text and on/off content labels.

platformVariations.name: Custom switch / role=switch
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom CSS slider, often mimicking iOS or Material style.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use role='switch' and aria-checked for accessibility. Toggle on click and Space/Enter.

name: Dropdown / Select
description: A control that lets users choose one option from a dropdown list that appears on interaction.

parts.label: Trigger / Button
parts.description: The visible element showing the current selection and a dropdown indicator.

parts.label: Dropdown List
parts.description: The expandable list of options that appears on interaction.

parts.label: Option Item
parts.description: Individual selectable item within the list.

parts.label: Selected Indicator
parts.description: Checkmark or highlight on the currently selected option.

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Text above or beside the trigger describing the field.

placement.position: Inline within forms and settings
placement.context: Used when the list of options is too long for radio buttons but a choice must be made.

behavior.appears: Trigger always visible; dropdown appears on click/tap.
behavior.interaction: Click/tap the trigger to expand; select an option to apply and close.
behavior.dismissal: Selecting an option, clicking outside, or pressing Escape closes the dropdown.

platformVariations.name: UIMenu / UIPickerView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Context menu style dropdown or spinning wheel picker for dates and values.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Menu picker appears as a popover; wheel picker scrolls with haptic detents.

platformVariations.name: NSPopUpButton
platformVariations.visualNotes: Pop-up button with beveled appearance; dropdown appears below.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports pull-down and pop-up modes. Arrow keys to navigate options.

platformVariations.name: ExposedDropdownMenu (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Text field with trailing icon; dropdown list appears below the field.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports filtering as the user types. Uses menu anchor pattern.

platformVariations.name: ComboBox (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Input field with dropdown arrow; may support editable text.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports type-ahead and editable combobox patterns.

platformVariations.name: select element / custom dropdown
platformVariations.visualNotes: Native select element or custom dropdown with styled options.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Native select is accessible but limited in styling. Custom dropdowns need ARIA listbox role.

name: Slider
description: A horizontal control with a draggable thumb that allows users to select a value from a continuous or discrete range.

parts.label: Track
parts.description: The horizontal line representing the full value range.

parts.label: Filled Track
parts.description: The portion of the track from the minimum to the current value.

parts.label: Thumb
parts.description: The draggable circular handle indicating the current value.

parts.label: Tick Marks
parts.description: Optional discrete step indicators along the track.

parts.label: Value Label
parts.description: Optional tooltip or text showing the current numeric value.

placement.position: Inline within settings, media controls, and adjustment panels
placement.context: Used for adjusting values like volume, brightness, or filter ranges.

behavior.appears: Always visible where a value range adjustment is needed.
behavior.interaction: Drag the thumb to change value; tap on the track to jump to a position.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists in the control context.
gestures: Tap on track to jump (varies by platform)

platformVariations.name: UISlider
platformVariations.visualNotes: Thin track with circular thumb; blue filled track, gray unfilled.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Continuous by default. Supports custom min/max images.

platformVariations.name: NSSlider
platformVariations.visualNotes: Horizontal or vertical; supports linear and circular variants.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports tick marks and snapping to discrete values.

platformVariations.name: Slider (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Track with colored fill; supports value label tooltip on drag.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Discrete steps with tick marks or continuous. Range slider (two thumbs) available.

platformVariations.name: Slider (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Track with thumb; supports tick marks and step increments.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Arrow keys for fine adjustment. Supports range mode.

platformVariations.name: input[type=range]
platformVariations.visualNotes: Browser-default slider; widely customized with CSS.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports min, max, step attributes. ARIA slider role for custom implementations.

name: Alert Dialog
description: A modal dialog that presents important information, warnings, or requires user confirmation before proceeding.

parts.label: Title
parts.description: Brief heading describing the alert purpose.

parts.label: Message Body
parts.description: Detailed description or question for the user.

parts.label: Action Buttons
parts.description: Buttons for user response (e.g., OK, Cancel, Delete).

parts.label: Scrim / Backdrop
parts.description: Dimmed background overlay indicating modal state.

placement.position: Centered on screen, overlaying content
placement.context: Appears when user action requires confirmation or attention to important information.

behavior.appears: Triggered by a user action or system event that requires attention.
behavior.interaction: User must respond by tapping an action button.
behavior.dismissal: Only dismissible by selecting an action button; some allow tap-outside or Escape.

platformVariations.name: UIAlertController (.alert)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Centered rounded rectangle with blurred background; stacked or side-by-side buttons.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Blocks interaction until dismissed. Supports text fields for input prompts.

platformVariations.name: NSAlert
platformVariations.visualNotes: Sheet attached to window or centered modal; includes app icon.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports informational, warning, and critical styles. Dismisses with button click or Enter/Escape.

platformVariations.name: AlertDialog (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded card with headline, body, and full-width action buttons; supports hero icon.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Scrim overlay blocks interaction. Can include custom content, lists, or date pickers.

platformVariations.name: ContentDialog (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Centered dialog with title, content, and up to three buttons.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Dimmed overlay. Supports primary, secondary, and close button styles.

platformVariations.name: dialog element / modal
platformVariations.visualNotes: Native dialog element or custom modal with backdrop; varies by framework.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use <dialog> with showModal() for proper focus trapping and Escape key handling.

name: Toast / Snackbar
description: A brief, non-blocking message that appears temporarily to provide feedback about an operation.

parts.label: Message Text
parts.description: Brief text describing the result or status.

parts.label: Action Button
parts.description: Optional single action like Undo or Retry.

parts.label: Close / Dismiss Icon
parts.description: Optional X button for manual dismissal.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: The message background, typically a dark or colored bar.

placement.position: Bottom of the screen (Android, web) or top (iOS, Windows)
placement.context: Appears after an action completes — saving, deleting, sending, etc.

behavior.appears: Triggered after an action completes; slides or fades in.
behavior.interaction: May include one action button (e.g., Undo). Otherwise, informational only.
behavior.dismissal: Auto-dismisses after a timeout (3–10 seconds); swipe to dismiss; or tap action.

platformVariations.name: Custom Toast (no native API)
platformVariations.visualNotes: iOS has no native toast. Often shown as a banner at the top or a pill at the bottom.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Typically custom implementation. System uses banner notifications for similar purpose.

platformVariations.name: Snackbar (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Dark container at the bottom with white text; may include one action.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Auto-dismisses; supports swipe-to-dismiss and action button. Stacks above FAB.

platformVariations.name: InfoBar (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Inline bar at the top of a page section; supports info, warning, error, success severities.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Persistent until dismissed by user or programmatically. Not a transient toast.

platformVariations.name: Toast / Notification
platformVariations.visualNotes: Typically fixed to a corner (bottom-right or top-right); styled cards that stack.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Auto-dismiss with timer. Uses ARIA role='status' or role='alert' for accessibility.

name: Progress Bar
description: A horizontal bar that indicates the progress of an operation, either as a determinate percentage or indeterminate animation.

parts.label: Track
parts.description: The background bar representing the total range.

parts.label: Fill / Indicator
parts.description: The colored portion showing current progress.

parts.label: Label / Percentage
parts.description: Optional text indicating progress value.

placement.position: Top of content area, within dialogs, or inline with content
placement.context: Shown during file uploads, downloads, installations, or any time-consuming operation.

behavior.appears: When an operation begins that has measurable or indeterminate progress.
behavior.interaction: Non-interactive; displays progress status only.
behavior.dismissal: Disappears when the operation completes.

platformVariations.name: UIProgressView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Thin horizontal bar (2-4pt height); tinted fill on gray track.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports determinate progress with 0.0–1.0 value. Smooth animated transitions.

platformVariations.name: NSProgressIndicator (bar)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Horizontal bar with system blue fill; may include text label.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports determinate and indeterminate modes. Integrates with NSProgress.

platformVariations.name: LinearProgressIndicator (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Thin bar with rounded ends; determinate or indeterminate wave animation.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be placed at the top of a screen as a loading indicator.

platformVariations.name: ProgressBar (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Horizontal bar with Fluent Design; supports determinate and indeterminate.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Indeterminate shows a looping animation. Can display error and paused states.

platformVariations.name: progress element / custom bar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Native progress element or custom div-based bar with CSS transitions.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use <progress> element with value and max attributes. ARIA progressbar for custom.

name: Spinner / Activity Indicator
description: A circular or spinning animation indicating that an operation is in progress with an indeterminate duration.

parts.label: Spinning Element
parts.description: The rotating graphic — an arc, dots, or segmented circle.

parts.label: Track
parts.description: Optional circular background track (for determinate spinners).

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Optional text like 'Loading...' adjacent to the spinner.

placement.position: Centered on screen, within buttons, or inline with content
placement.context: Shown during indeterminate loading states — fetching data, processing requests.

behavior.appears: When an asynchronous operation begins with no determinate progress.
behavior.interaction: Non-interactive; visual indicator only.
behavior.dismissal: Disappears when the operation completes or times out.

platformVariations.name: UIActivityIndicatorView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Spinning daisy wheel in white or gray; medium and large sizes.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Hides automatically when stopped. Often centered in a view or inside navigation.

platformVariations.name: NSProgressIndicator (spinning)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Spinning gear/flower icon; standard macOS system appearance.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Small and regular sizes. Used in toolbars and content areas.

platformVariations.name: CircularProgressIndicator (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Arc that rotates and sweeps; supports determinate (percentage) mode.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Indeterminate animation loops continuously. Can also show determinate progress.

platformVariations.name: ProgressRing (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Circular ring with orbiting dots; supports determinate fill mode.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Indeterminate shows chasing dots; determinate shows arc fill. Supports text content inside.

platformVariations.name: CSS spinner / SVG animation
platformVariations.visualNotes: Typically a CSS-animated border-radius circle or SVG arc rotation.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use ARIA role='progressbar' or role='status' with aria-busy for accessibility.

name: Badge
description: A small indicator overlaid on an icon or element, showing a count, status, or notification dot.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: Small circle or pill shape; red/accent color by default.

parts.label: Count Text
parts.description: Optional number inside the badge (e.g., 3, 99+).

parts.label: Dot Variant
parts.description: Smaller variant with no text, just a colored dot indicating presence.

placement.position: Overlaid on the top-right corner of an icon, tab item, or avatar
placement.context: Used on tab bar icons, app icons, notification bells, and inbox indicators.

behavior.appears: When there are new notifications, unread items, or status changes.
behavior.interaction: Non-interactive by itself; the parent element is the tap target.
behavior.dismissal: Disappears when the associated items are viewed or cleared.

platformVariations.name: Badge on UITabBarItem / app icon
platformVariations.visualNotes: Red circle with white count text; dot variant for minimal indication.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Automatically managed by the system for app icon badges. Tab bar badges set programmatically.

platformVariations.name: Dock badge / NSSBadge
platformVariations.visualNotes: Red circle on Dock app icon; badge count in menu bar items.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Set via NSDockTile API. Sidebar badges show as rounded pill with count.

platformVariations.name: Badge (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Small dot or number badge on navigation items; positioned at top-right.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports small (dot) and large (number) variants. Anchored to navigation items.

platformVariations.name: InfoBadge (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Dot, icon, or count badge with attention, informational, success, caution, and critical styles.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be placed on NavigationViewItem or other elements. Supports multiple severity levels.

platformVariations.name: Badge (CSS)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom-styled span positioned absolute over parent element.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use aria-label to convey badge count to screen readers. Not interactive.

name: Modal
description: A full or partial overlay that covers the current content and requires interaction before the user can return to the underlying screen.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: The visible dialog window or sheet with content.

parts.label: Header
parts.description: Title bar with title text and close/done buttons.

parts.label: Content Area
parts.description: The main body where forms, information, or media are displayed.

parts.label: Footer / Actions
parts.description: Action buttons at the bottom (Save, Cancel, etc.).

parts.label: Scrim / Backdrop
parts.description: Dimmed or blurred overlay behind the modal.

placement.position: Centered on screen or slides up from bottom (sheet style)
placement.context: Used for creation flows, editing, login, settings, and any focused task.

behavior.appears: Triggered by a user action (e.g., 'New', 'Edit', 'Settings').
behavior.interaction: User interacts with modal content; must explicitly save/dismiss.
behavior.dismissal: Close button, action button (Save/Cancel), swipe down (sheet), or Escape key.

platformVariations.name: UISheetPresentationController / modal
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom sheet with drag indicator and detents (medium/large); or full-screen modal.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Sheet style supports half-height and full-height detents. Swipe down to dismiss.

platformVariations.name: NSWindow sheet / modal
platformVariations.visualNotes: Sheet slides down from parent window title bar; modal is centered window.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Sheets are attached to a window. Modals block app-wide interaction.

platformVariations.name: FullScreenDialog / BottomSheetDialog (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Full-screen dialog with top bar or bottom sheet with drag handle.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Full-screen dialog uses close icon (X) and action in top bar. Bottom sheet can be dragged.

platformVariations.name: ContentDialog (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Centered dialog with smoke overlay; max width constrained.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Blocks underlying content. Supports primary, secondary, and close buttons.

platformVariations.name: dialog / modal overlay
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom modal with backdrop; varies from small centered cards to full-screen overlays.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use <dialog> showModal() for proper focus trapping, backdrop, and Escape key support.

name: Popover
description: A small overlay that appears next to a trigger element, showing additional content or actions without navigating away.

parts.label: Arrow / Caret
parts.description: A triangular pointer connecting the popover to its trigger element.

parts.label: Content Area
parts.description: The body of the popover containing text, controls, or a list.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: The popover background with border, shadow, and rounded corners.

placement.position: Adjacent to the trigger element; auto-positions to stay within viewport
placement.context: Used for additional options, previews, or settings near a specific element.

behavior.appears: On tap/click of a trigger element.
behavior.interaction: Interact with content inside the popover.
behavior.dismissal: Tap/click outside the popover, press Escape, or select an action.

platformVariations.name: UIPopoverPresentationController
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded rectangle with arrow pointing to source; white background with shadow.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: On iPad, appears as floating popover. On iPhone, falls back to sheet presentation.

platformVariations.name: NSPopover
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded popover with arrow; semi-transient or transient behavior.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be transient (dismiss on click outside) or semi-transient (persistent until explicit close).

platformVariations.name: PopupWindow / Menu
platformVariations.visualNotes: Elevated card without arrow; positioned near the trigger element.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: No arrow indicator by default. Dismiss on outside touch or back button.

platformVariations.name: Flyout (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Light dismiss overlay attached to a control; supports various content.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Light dismiss behavior — closes on outside click, Escape, or scroll.

platformVariations.name: Popover API / custom popover
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom positioned element with optional arrow; uses Popper.js or Floating UI.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: HTML Popover API (popover attribute) or custom JS positioning. Focus management important.

name: Tooltip
description: A small text popup that appears on hover or long-press to describe an element's function.

parts.label: Text Label
parts.description: Brief descriptive text about the target element.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: A small rounded background, typically dark with light text.

parts.label: Arrow
parts.description: Optional pointer connecting tooltip to the target element.

placement.position: Adjacent to the target element; typically above, below, or beside
placement.context: Used on icon buttons, abbreviated labels, and any element needing explanation.

behavior.appears: On hover (desktop) or long-press (mobile) after a short delay.
behavior.interaction: Non-interactive; disappears when hover/press ends.
behavior.dismissal: Automatically disappears when the pointer moves away or touch ends.

platformVariations.name: NSToolTipManager
platformVariations.visualNotes: Yellow-tinted small rectangle near the cursor; system font.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Appears after ~1 second hover delay. System-managed positioning.

platformVariations.name: TooltipCompat / PlainTooltip (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Small dark container with white text; no arrow by default.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Appears on long press. Rich tooltip variant supports title and action.

platformVariations.name: ToolTip (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Small acrylic popup near the target element.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Hover-triggered with delay. Keyboard accessible via focus.

platformVariations.name: title attribute / custom tooltip
platformVariations.visualNotes: Browser-native title tooltip or custom CSS/JS tooltip with positioning.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Native title attribute has no styling control. Custom tooltips need ARIA tooltip role.

name: Action Sheet / Bottom Sheet
description: A panel that slides up from the bottom of the screen presenting a set of actions or options related to the current context.

parts.label: Handle / Drag Indicator
parts.description: A small bar at the top used to drag the sheet.

parts.label: Title / Message
parts.description: Optional header explaining the context of the actions.

parts.label: Action List
parts.description: Vertical list of action buttons, with destructive actions highlighted.

parts.label: Cancel Button
parts.description: Separate button at the bottom for dismissing without action (iOS).

parts.label: Scrim
parts.description: Dimmed background overlay.

placement.position: Bottom edge of the screen, sliding upward
placement.context: Used for contextual actions (share, delete, more options) triggered from a long-press or action button.

behavior.appears: Slides up from the bottom when triggered by user action.
behavior.interaction: Tap an action to execute it and dismiss the sheet.
behavior.dismissal: Tap Cancel, tap scrim, swipe down, or press Escape.

platformVariations.name: UIAlertController (.actionSheet)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded list of actions with Cancel separated at bottom; iPad shows as popover.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Destructive actions shown in red. Cancel button is visually separated.

platformVariations.name: BottomSheetDialog (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom sheet with drag handle; supports list and grid layouts.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports half-expanded and fully-expanded states. Dismissible by swipe or scrim tap.

platformVariations.name: Bottom Sheet / Action Sheet
platformVariations.visualNotes: Fixed-bottom overlay with action list; common in mobile web apps.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Implemented with CSS transforms and JavaScript touch handlers. Focus trap needed.

name: Context Menu
description: A floating menu that appears at the pointer position (right-click) or on a long-press, showing contextual actions for the target element.

parts.label: Menu Container
parts.description: The floating panel holding the menu items.

parts.label: Menu Item
parts.description: Individual action with icon, label, and optional shortcut text.

parts.label: Submenu Arrow
parts.description: Indicator that a menu item expands into a nested submenu.

parts.label: Separator
parts.description: Divider between groups of related actions.

parts.label: Preview
parts.description: Optional content preview above the menu (iOS context menus).

placement.position: At the pointer/touch position, anchored to the target element
placement.context: Appears on right-click (desktop) or long-press (mobile) on contextual elements.

behavior.appears: On right-click (desktop) or long-press/3D Touch (mobile).
behavior.interaction: Select a menu item to execute its action.
behavior.dismissal: Click/tap outside, select an item, or press Escape.

platformVariations.name: UIMenu / UIContextMenuInteraction
platformVariations.visualNotes: Blurred menu with rounded items; optional preview with 3D lift effect.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Long-press triggers with haptic feedback. Supports nested submenus and inline sections.

platformVariations.name: NSMenu (contextual)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Standard system menu at cursor position; supports icons and shortcuts.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Right-click or Control-click triggers. Supports submenus and disabled items.

platformVariations.name: PopupMenu / ContextMenu
platformVariations.visualNotes: Elevated card with text items near the touch point.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Long-press triggers. Supports icons, grouping, and nested submenus.

platformVariations.name: MenuFlyout (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Acrylic flyout menu with icons and keyboard shortcuts.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Right-click triggers. Supports radio items, toggle items, and submenus.

platformVariations.name: contextmenu event / custom menu
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom-styled floating menu replacing browser default context menu.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Prevent default contextmenu event and render custom menu. Needs keyboard navigation support.

name: List / Table View
description: A vertically scrolling container that displays items in rows, supporting sections, headers, and various cell layouts.

parts.label: Row / Cell
parts.description: Individual item container with content layout.

parts.label: Section Header
parts.description: Optional sticky header grouping related rows.

parts.label: Leading Content
parts.description: Left-aligned icon, avatar, or thumbnail in a row.

parts.label: Primary / Secondary Text
parts.description: Main label and supporting detail text.

parts.label: Trailing Accessory
parts.description: Right-aligned element: disclosure indicator, switch, badge, etc.

parts.label: Divider
parts.description: Horizontal line separating rows.

placement.position: Main content area, filling available vertical space
placement.context: Used for settings, feeds, contacts, messages, and any sequential content.

behavior.appears: Visible as the primary content view; loads data dynamically.
behavior.interaction: Tap a row to navigate or select; swipe for contextual actions; pull to refresh.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; it is the content itself.

platformVariations.name: UITableView / UICollectionView (list)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Grouped or plain style; inset rounded sections. Swipe actions with colored backgrounds.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Swipe-to-delete, swipe actions, pull-to-refresh, edit mode with drag-to-reorder.

platformVariations.name: NSTableView / NSOutlineView
platformVariations.visualNotes: Column-based table or outline view with source list style.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports column sorting, resize, and reorder. Outline view supports expand/collapse.

platformVariations.name: RecyclerView + LazyColumn
platformVariations.visualNotes: Flat or sectioned list with Material card items or simple text rows.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Efficient recycling of views. Supports ItemTouchHelper for swipe and drag.

platformVariations.name: ListView (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Single-column list with selection states; supports grouped headers.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports single, multiple, and extended selection. Incremental loading.

platformVariations.name: ul/ol lists / virtual scrolling
platformVariations.visualNotes: Styled list elements or custom div-based rows with CSS grid/flex.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Virtual scrolling for large lists (react-window, etc.). ARIA list/listitem roles.

name: Card
description: A contained surface that groups related content and actions, typically with elevation/shadow and rounded corners.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: Rounded rectangle with background, shadow, and border.

parts.label: Media / Image
parts.description: Optional top image or graphic area.

parts.label: Header
parts.description: Title and subtitle text, often with an avatar or icon.

parts.label: Body Content
parts.description: Supporting text or content in the middle area.

parts.label: Action Area
parts.description: Buttons, icons, or links at the bottom of the card.

placement.position: In grids, lists, or standalone in content areas
placement.context: Used for news feeds, product listings, dashboards, and content previews.

behavior.appears: Always visible as a content container.
behavior.interaction: May be tappable as a whole (navigates to detail) or contain individual interactive elements.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persistent content element.

platformVariations.name: Card (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Three variants: elevated (shadow), filled (flat), and outlined (border).
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be clickable with ripple effect. Supports expandable cards.

platformVariations.name: Card / Expander
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded container with subtle background; often part of settings pages.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: May support expand/collapse pattern for grouped settings.

platformVariations.name: Card (CSS)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Container with border-radius, box-shadow, and padding; universal pattern.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Implement as <article> or <div> with proper heading hierarchy for accessibility.

name: Divider / Separator
description: A thin horizontal or vertical line that separates content sections or list items.

parts.label: Line
parts.description: The thin visible line (typically 1px or hairline width).

parts.label: Inset
parts.description: Optional left/right margin to align with content (e.g., after an avatar in a list).

placement.position: Between content sections, list items, or layout regions
placement.context: Used to visually separate groups of content without adding spacing.

behavior.appears: Always visible as a structural element.
behavior.interaction: Non-interactive; purely visual.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; structural element.

platformVariations.name: Separator (SwiftUI) / cell separator
platformVariations.visualNotes: Hairline gray line; may be inset to align with text in list cells.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Automatically managed by UITableView; can be hidden per-cell.

platformVariations.name: NSBox (separator)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Thin horizontal or vertical line; system gray color.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Used in toolbars, sidebars, and split views.

platformVariations.name: Divider (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: 1dp line; full-bleed or inset variant with start padding.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Can be horizontal or vertical. Supports full-width and middle-inset.

platformVariations.name: MenuFlyoutSeparator / custom divider
platformVariations.visualNotes: Thin line in menus and lists; system styling.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Used in navigation views, command bars, and list separators.

platformVariations.name: hr element / border
platformVariations.visualNotes: Native hr element or CSS border on adjacent elements.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use role='separator' for non-hr dividers. aria-orientation for vertical dividers.

name: Floating Action Button
description: A prominent circular button floating above the content, representing the primary action on a screen.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: Circular or pill-shaped elevated surface.

parts.label: Icon
parts.description: Centered icon representing the primary action (e.g., + for create).

parts.label: Label
parts.description: Optional text label next to the icon (extended FAB).

parts.label: Shadow / Elevation
parts.description: Drop shadow indicating the floating elevation.

placement.position: Bottom-right corner of the screen, floating above content
placement.context: Used on screens where one primary action is most important (compose, add, create).

behavior.appears: Always visible or may hide on scroll; represents the screen's primary action.
behavior.interaction: Tap to trigger the primary action; may expand to reveal secondary actions.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persistent action element.

platformVariations.name: FloatingActionButton (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Three sizes: small, regular, large. Supports surface, primary, secondary, and tertiary colors.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Animates on scroll (hide/show). Extended FAB collapses to icon-only on scroll.

platformVariations.name: FAB (CSS/JS)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Fixed-position circular button; often Material Design-inspired.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Position: fixed at bottom-right. Should not obscure important content. Ensure focus management.

name: Segmented Control
description: A horizontal set of mutually exclusive buttons allowing the user to toggle between two or more views or options.

parts.label: Segment
parts.description: Individual button within the group, showing text or icon.

parts.label: Selected Indicator
parts.description: Visual highlight (fill, underline, or pill) on the active segment.

parts.label: Container
parts.description: The overall bar containing all segments.

placement.position: Inline within navigation bars, toolbars, or form sections
placement.context: Used to switch between related views (e.g., List/Grid, Day/Week/Month).

behavior.appears: Always visible where view switching options exist.
behavior.interaction: Tap a segment to switch to that view or option.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists as a control.

platformVariations.name: UISegmentedControl
platformVariations.visualNotes: Rounded bar with sliding white pill indicator over gray background.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports 2–5 segments. Spring animation when switching. Integrates in navigation bars.

platformVariations.name: NSSegmentedControl
platformVariations.visualNotes: Separated or capsule style segments with system appearance.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports select-one or select-any (toggle) tracking modes.

platformVariations.name: SegmentedButton (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Outlined button group with filled indicator on selected segment.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports single-select and multi-select modes. Icon or text segments.

platformVariations.name: ToggleButton group / Segmented
platformVariations.visualNotes: Group of toggle buttons with shared container.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Keyboard navigable with arrow keys within the group.

platformVariations.name: Button group / radio group
platformVariations.visualNotes: Inline button group with CSS styling; active state highlight.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use role='radiogroup' with role='radio' for single-select. aria-pressed for toggles.
